original_instructions:
Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour. Drain and reserve the juice. In a large bowl combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound cooked, cleaned shrimp, chopped in 1/4 inch dice
1/4 pound tomatillos, husks removed and diced
1 small avocado, peeled and pit removed

step_by_step_instructions: Marinate the shrimp in the lime juice for one hour.
Drain the shrimp and reserve the lime juice.
In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, tomatillos, green onions, jalapenos, garlic, cilantro, avocados, salt, and pepper.
Toss the mixture to coat all ingredients.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl; pour the hot stock over it and stir to combine. Cover and let sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork. Add the apricots, scallions, and orange juice; drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine. Garnish with chopped parsley.
ingredients: 2 scallions, sliced thin, green parts only
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves, for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Put the couscous in a medium bowl.
Pour the hot stock over the couscous and stir to combine.
Cover the bowl and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes.
Uncover the bowl and fluff the couscous with a fork.
Add the chopped apricots, sliced scallions, and orange juice to the couscous.
Drizzle the mixture with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Toss the ingredients gently to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley.

original_instructions:
Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat. Add the onion and saute until soft, but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas. Add the peas, carrots and string beans, and cook slightly, about 2 minutes. Add boiling water and rice, cover tightly and simmer for 1520 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir with a fork and serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 pound string beans, cut into small pieces

step_by_step_instructions: Place the rice in a large bowl and rinse under cold running water for 5 minutes.
Drain the rice and set aside.
Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and saute for 1 more minute to release the aromas.
Add the peas, carrots, and string beans, and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add boiling water and rice to the saucepan, cover tightly and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Stir the rice with a fork and serve hot.

original_instructions:
Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens. Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.
Tip: To save time, you can use 2 cans (4.5 ounces each) Swanson® Premium White Chunk Chicken Breast in Water, drained, for the turkey in this recipe.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder or 1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 cup green or red pepper cut into 2-inch long strips
2 cups cubed cooked turkey or chicken
1/2 of a 16 ounce package spaghetti, cooked without salt, and drained (about 4 cups)

step_by_step_instructions: Stir the cornstarch and 1/4 cup stock in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
Heat the remaining stock, garlic powder, broccoli, carrots, pepper, and onion in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the cornstarch mixture.
Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens.
Stir in the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
Toss with the spaghetti and cheese.

recipe_title: POTATO-HORSERADISH CRUSTED RED SNAPPER WITH ROASTED PEPPER RELISH
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper. Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking. Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes. Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium. Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish. Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. May be refrigerated up to 1 day. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 8 red snapper fillets, 5 to 6 ounces each
1 large potato, peeled and finely grated
2 red bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced
2 yellow bell peppers, roasted, peeled, seeded and diced

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season each fillet to taste with salt and pepper.
Combine the potato and horseradish and spread the mixture over the top of each fillet, pressing it down so it will adhere.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until almost smoking.
Sear each fillet potato-side down until a crust forms, about 3 minutes.
Turn the fillets over and finish cooking in the oven until done, about 5 minutes for medium.
Place on a large serving platter and top each fillet with some relish.
Serve any remaining relish on the side.
In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, olives, pepper flakes, garlic, thyme, parsley, vinegar, honey, and oil.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
May be refrigerated up to 1 day.
Serve at room temperature.

recipe_title: Grilled Moroccan Spiced Pork Tenderloin with Creamy Harissa Sauce
original_instructions:
In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt and olive oil. Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking. Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes. Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer. Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: Kosher salt and cracked black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and olive oil.
Rub the mixture evenly over the pork tenderloins.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Prepare a grill for high heat cooking.
Place the tenderloins on the grill and cook until browned and nicely marked, 8 to 10 minutes.
Turn the tenderloins and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the center of each registers between 155 degrees F and 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes longer.
Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board, tent with foil and let rest for 10 minutes.
Slice and serve hot or at room temperature with Creamy Harissa Sauce.
In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, harissa and garlic until combined.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Sift the flour with the salt, and knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover with a moist cloth and let rise for 1/2 an hour.
Meanwhile, combine ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again, and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls. Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 of them, cover with the remaining disks, and roll out into a 4 to 5 inch discs. Brush the breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat. They can also be cooked on a charcoal grill or pancake griddle. Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.
ingredients: 1 potato, baked, cooled, peeled and mashed

step_by_step_instructions: Sift the flour with the salt.
Knead into a soft dough by adding the yogurt, butter, and water.
Cover the dough with a moist cloth and let it rise for 30 minutes.
Combine the ingredients for the potato filling in a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
Knead the dough again and divide into 8 equal parts, rolling them into small balls.
Using a rolling pin, roll out each ball into a round disc approximately 3 inches in diameter.
Place the potato filling in the center of 4 discs, cover with the remaining discs and roll out into 4 to 5 inch discs.
Brush the stuffed breads with soft butter.
Place the stuffed breads on a non-stick or well-seasoned cast iron pan on medium-high heat.
Cook till both sides are golden brown, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side.

original_instructions:
Lay peppers on their sides on racks of gas burners and turn flames on moderately high. Roast, turning frequently with tongs, until skins are blackened, 5 to 8 minutes. (Or broil on rack of a broiler pan about 4 inches from heat, turning frequently, 15 to 20 minutes.)
Transfer to a bowl, then cover, and let steam 10 minutes. Alternatively, place peppers in resealable plastic bags to steam. Peel peppers and discard stems and seeds. Cut lengthwise into 1-inch-wide strips.
In a bowl, place cleaned peppers. Douse with balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper, to taste.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Lay peppers on their sides on racks of gas burners.
Turn flames on moderately high.
Roast, turning frequently with tongs, until skins are blackened, 5 to 8 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl, then cover, and let steam for 10 minutes.
Peel peppers and discard stems and seeds.
Cut lengthwise into 1-inch-wide strips.
In a bowl, place cleaned peppers.
Douse with balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper to taste.

original_instructions: Place the lettuce in a bed on the bottom of the hot dog roll. Layer the lobster meat on top of the lettuce and place a dab of mayonnaise on top of the meat. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 hot dog roll, toasted (recommended: "New England-style" hot dog roll, no crust, split on top)
3 to 4 ounces freshly picked lobster meat (1 lobster's worth)

step_by_step_instructions: Place the lettuce in a bed on the bottom of the hot dog roll.
Layer the lobster meat on top of the lettuce.
Place a dab of mayonnaise on top of the meat.
Enjoy!

recipe_title: Roasted Sweet Potato and Green Onion Salad
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Brush the potatoes and green onions with olive oil. Roast the potatoes until tender. Roast the green onions until softened. When cool enough to handle, cut the potatoes into 1-inch cubes and finely chop the green onions.
In a large bowl, whisk together the remaining 1/2 cup olive oil, the mustard, vinegars, and honey, and season with salt and pepper. Add the potatoes, green onions and parsley and mix until the potatoes are coated with the dressing. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper.
ingredients: 1 bunch green onions (white bulb and 3 inches of green)
1/2 cup olive oil, plus extra for brushing the potatoes and green onions
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Brush the sweet potatoes and green onions with olive oil.
Roast the sweet potatoes until tender.
Roast the green onions until softened.
When cool enough to handle, cut the sweet potatoes into 1-inch cubes.
Finely chop the green onions.
In a large bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup olive oil, Dijon mustard, cider vinegar, balsamic vinegar, and honey.
Season the dressing with salt and pepper.
Add the sweet potatoes, green onions, and parsley to the dressing.
Mix until the sweet potatoes are coated with the dressing.
Season to taste with additional salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the eggs in a large pot and fill with cold water; bring to a boil. Immediately remove from the heat and cover the pot for 10 minutes. Drain and then submerge the eggs in cold water. Peel, slice and set aside.
Lay the bacon on a paper-towel-lined microwave-safe plate. Cover with another paper towel. Microwave on high for 4 to 5 minutes. Crumble or cut the bacon into small pieces.
To make the dressing, whisk the yogurt, mayonnaise, lime juice and cayenne together.
Line the bottom of four serving bowls with the lettuce. Layer the red pepper rings, crumbled bacon, black beans, sliced egg and corn in each bowl. Drizzle the dressing over the salads and sprinkle the cheese on top. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 3/4 tablespoon nonfat Greek yogurt
1 red bell pepper, stemmed, ribs removed, seeded and sliced across in 1/4-inch rings
One 15.5-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed

step_by_step_instructions: Place the eggs in a large pot and fill with cold water.
Bring the pot to a boil.
Immediately remove the pot from heat and cover it for 10 minutes.
Drain the water from the pot and submerge the eggs in cold water.
Peel the eggs, slice them, and set aside.
Lay the bacon on a paper-towel-lined microwave-safe plate.
Cover the bacon with another paper towel.
Microwave the bacon on high for 4 to 5 minutes.
Crumble or cut the bacon into small pieces.
Whisk the yogurt, mayonnaise, lime juice, and cayenne together to make the dressing.
Line the bottom of four serving bowls with the lettuce.
Layer the red pepper rings, crumbled bacon, black beans, sliced egg, and corn in each bowl.
Drizzle the dressing over the salads.
Sprinkle the cheese on top of the salads.
Refrigerate the salads for at least 30 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Melt the butter with minced cilantro. Roll out bread between two pieces of waxed paper until very thin. Brush bread lightly on both sides with melted butter mixture.
In a bowl combine cheese, cumin, peppers, and scallions. Place some of the filling, about 1 heaping teaspoon, in the center of each slice. Fold making a triangle shape, trim edges. Press the edges with your fingers to tightly seal. Brush tops and bottoms with melted cilantro butter and crimp edges with fork (At this point, the turnovers can be placed in a zippered plastic freezer bag and frozen for future use.) Place on parchment lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes (20 to 25 minutes if taken out of the freezer) or until golden brown. Serve warm with salsa dipping sauce.
ingredients: 16 slices fresh home-made type white bread, crusts removed

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Melt the butter with minced cilantro.
Roll out bread between two pieces of waxed paper until very thin.
Brush bread lightly on both sides with melted butter mixture.
In a bowl combine cheese, cumin, peppers, and scallions.
Place about 1 heaping teaspoon of the filling in the center of each slice.
Fold the bread over the filling to make a triangle shape and trim the edges.
Press the edges with your fingers to tightly seal.
Brush tops and bottoms with melted cilantro butter.
Crimp the edges with a fork.
Place on a parchment lined baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown (20 to 25 minutes if frozen).
Serve warm with salsa dipping sauce.
